Muscle.name: Go Toe To Toe
Muscle.description: When you use your abilities to overcome someone or something in a struggle for control, state what your goal is. Your opponent can describe how they respond, at their option. Roll+Muscle.

outcomes.6-: You fail to accomplish your goal, and take Harm or Stress as established

hold: You manage to achieve your goal, e.g., take something they hold.
You get them good, giving your opponent harm as established by your attacks
You block, dodge, or counter their best attempts.(If you don't choose this, they will do Harm to you as established).

Muscle.name: Hit With All You've Got
Muscle.description: When you have a clear shot and you use your strength to hit someone or something with all you've got, roll+Muscle. On a hit, you give Harm to your opponent as established.

outcomes.6-: You fail to hit them and, and take Harm or Stress as established

hold: You take cover or secure a superior position. If you don't choose this, they can give you Harm
You get them good (+1 Harm).
You control the collateral damage.
You hold the target's attention, if possible.
You gain the upper hand. Take 1 Juice.

Finesse.name: Sneak Around
Finesse.description: When you use your agility to act secretly or deceptively, roll+Finesse.

outcomes.13+: Everyone that should fall for it falls for it, and you get a little something extra. Take 1 Juice.
outcomes.10+: Everyone that should fall for it falls for it.
outcomes.7-9: As above, but it's complicated. The MC chooses 1:
outcomes.6-: You are noticed, but still have a chance to escape

hold: Someone unimportant noticed you, but that just made them important, right?
You are perceived only by a secondary sense (someone picks up your scent while you're stalking them; you're seen whispering a message but the message is not heard).
You must leave something important behind or be discovered

Finesse.name: Take The Shot
Finesse.description: When you take aim and shoot at an enemy at range (close or far), roll +Finesse.

outcomes.7-9: You deal damage but lose your position; you must move to take another shot.
outcomes.6-: You miss and the MC makes a move against you

hold: You keep your position for another shot
You create an advantage. Take 1 Juice
Do 1 more harm

Grit.name: To Protect and Serve
Grit.description: When you stand in defense of another person, an item, or a location under attack, roll +Grit.

outcomes.13+: As for 10+, and inflict 1 Harm or Stress on the attacker
outcomes.6-: The original target takes harm as established, and your attempts backfires. You take -1 forward, 1 Harm, or 1 Stress, or the target takes 1 more Harm or Stress

hold: Redirect an attack to yourself
Reduce the Harm or Stress of the attack by 1
Create an advantage. Create 1 Juice

Grit.name: Tough It Out
Grit.description: When you suffer harm, illness, poison, exhaustion, or deprivation, roll +Grit. On cases of direct physical harm, roll +Grit+Armor

outcomes.13+: Avoid all Harm or Stress. If the harm or Stress is <3, heal 1 Harm or Stress
outcomes.10+: You shake it off. Harm or Stress is reduced by 2
outcomes.7-9: You take the effect but it is reduced. Harm or Stress is reduced by 1.
outcomes.6-: The effect as expected. Take Harm or Stress as established

Moxie.name: Talk Them Into It
Moxie.description: When you use your abilities to talk, threaten, or seduce someone into doing something, roll+Moxie.

outcomes.13+: Hold 3, and you may turn them into a +0 Contact
outcomes.6-: Hold 1, but the target becomes hostile

hold: Change the target's agenda 1-for-1 to your agena
Inflict 1 Stress on the target
Have the target comply without questions or a need for reassurance, payment, or coercion
Have them comply without eliciting suspicion from those around you

Moxie.name: Draw Them Out
Moxie.description: Use your charisma to get information from a target. When you try to charm answers from a target, roll+Moxie:

outcomes.13+: Hold 3, and you can Ask Any Question instead of just those listed
outcomes.10+: Hold 3: Spend your hold 1-for-1 to ask one of the following questions, and the MC will answer truthfully:
outcomes.6-: Hold 1, but the target becomes hostile, or the MC will answer give you an answer that you wish wasn't true

hold: What do you or an associate want?
What do you or an associate plan to do?
What are you or an associate hiding?
What is you or an associate's greatest power?
What is you or an associate's greatest weakness

Smarts.name: Investigate a Mystery
Smarts.description: When you investigate a mystery, roll +Smarts. Note: Once per Mystery, you may also roll against Explore Logos/Mythos Lore from the answers to these questions.

outcomes.13+: Hold 2. You can ask any Question, not just the listed ones
outcomes.10+: Hold 2. Hold can be spent 1 for 1 to ask Keeper one of the following questions
outcomes.7-9: Hold 1. Hold can be spent 1 for 1 to ask Keeper one of the following questions
outcomes.6-: Hold 1, and the MC will give you an answer you don't want to hear.

hold: What happened here?
What sort of entity is it?
What are it's powers?
What are it's weaknesses?
Where did it go?
What was it going to do?
What is being concealed here?

Smarts.name: Read a Bad Situation
Smarts.description: When you look around and read a bad situation, roll +Smarts.

outcomes.13+: Hold 3. You can ask any Question, not just the listed ones
outcomes.10+: Hold 3. Hold can be spent 1 for 1 to ask Keeper one of the following questions. If you act on the answers, you get +1 ongoing while the information is relevant:
outcomes.6-: Hold 1, and the MC will give you an answer you don't want to hear.

hold: What's my best way in?
What's my best way out?
Are there any dangers we haven't noticed?
What's the biggest threat?
What's most vulnerable to me?
What's the best way to protect the Victims?

Coin.name: Shell Out
Coin.description: When you need to make a purchase, the MC will set a Price. Roll +Loot+Price. Note: You may use Change the Game to try to improve your odds, but once you roll, you are committed to the outcome

outcomes.13+: You get exactly what you wanted, +a little something extra. Take 1 [Gear]
outcomes.10+: You get exactly what you wanted
outcomes.7-9: You get what what you wanted, but it is somehow flawed or inferior. The MC will tell you how
outcomes.6-: You get what what you wanted, but it is wildly flawed or inferior. The MC will tell you how at the worst possible moment

Coin.name: Grease the Wheels
Coin.description: When you wish to bribe someone or impress them with your status, roll+Coin. Note: You may use Change the Game to try to improve your odds, but once you roll, you are committed to the outcome

outcomes.13+: Change the target's agenda to your agenda, and you may turn them into a +0 Contact
outcomes.10+: Change the target's agenda to your agenda
outcomes.7-9: Change the target's agenda to your agenda, but you must surrender 1 [Gear] or take -1 Ongoing to Coin for the rest of the session
outcomes.6-: The target changes its agenda to the opposite of your agenda

Moves.name: Change the Game
Moves.description: When you modify the situation to generate a bonus for yourself or a hindrance for your opponent, describe the outcome you want. Then roll +the most relevant attribute (MC's decision)

outcomes.13+: Take 2 Juice and juice may also be spent to: Give +1 ongoing to yourself or one of your crew, Complete a Clock, Reset a Clock
outcomes.6-: It backfires. You take -1 forward, 1 Harm, or 1 Stress

hold: Give a +1 forward to yourself or one of your Crew
Advance a Clock
Roll back a Clock
Inflict 1 Stress on a target

Moves.name: Take the Risk
Moves.description: When you do something risky that is not covered by another move, describe the outcome you want. Then roll +the most relevant attribute (MC's decision)

outcomes.10+: It goes off without a hitch
outcomes.7-9: It works, but with a side-effect, cost, or hard choice
outcomes.6-: Something goes wrong. The MC will make a move against you

Moves.name: Cultivate a Mythos/Logos Contact
Moves.description: Once per Job, when you meet an NPC and want to turn them into a contact, roll. If they are a Sleeper, or otherwise are part of your mundane life, roll +Logos. Otherwise roll +Mythos. You can only have 5 contacts, so if you have gain a new contact when you have 5, you must drop one to make room.

outcomes.13+: Create a new contact with a +1 contact rating
outcomes.10+: Create a new contact with a +0 contact rating. Record what they are good at (Expertise), and how you know them (Relationship).
outcomes.7-9: The NPC becomes a contact, but one that doesnâ€™t necessarily like or trust you. Record them with a -1 contact rating, note what they are good at, and the source of the conflict
outcomes.6-: The potential contact turns against you. They will do what they can to foil your plans

Moves.name: Explore Mythos/Logos Lore
Moves.description: Once per session, in response to an answer from Investigate a Mystery you may declare a linkage between the answer and either your Logos Statement or your Mythos Question. When you do, describe how the mystery is linked to your Mythos Question or Logos Statement, and roll +Logos or +Mythos as appropriate. (When choosing options, you can choose the same option more than once). Based on your roll, you have an insight that is:

outcomes.13+: World-Altering. Choose 3 of the following options:
outcomes.10+: Powerful. Choose 2 of the following options:
outcomes.7-9: Minor. Choose 1 of the following options:
outcomes.6-: Searing: The MC will tell you why this knowledge is traumatizing. Mark Attention on your Logos/Mythos, but also mark Crack/Fade as appropriate.

hold: Mark 1 Attention to your Mythos/Logos as appropriate
Heal 1 Fade/Crack as appropriate
Take +1 ongoing when acting on the answer to the question using your Mythos or Logos, as appropriate

rollback.name: Physical Downtime
rollback.description: For every 12 hours of Physical Downtime with medical, recover 1 Harm

rollback.name: Physical First Aid
rollback.description: When characters have 1 hour of Down Time, a Rift may perform Physical First Aid on another Rift to heal 1 Harm. Only 1 instance of Physical First Aid can be performed on a Rift between Down Time sessions. A character cannot perform Physical First Aid on themself.

rollback.name: Mental Downtime
rollback.description: For every 12 hours of Mental Downtime with psychological care, recover 1 Stress

rollback.name: Psych First Aid
rollback.description: When characters have 1 hour of Down Time, a Rift may perform Psych First Aid on another Rift to heal 1 Stress. Only 1 instance of Psych First Aid can be performed on a Rift between Down Time sessions. A character cannot perform Psych First Aid on themself.

ContactMove.name: Work your Connections
ContactMove.description: You may go to each Contact for help once per job during the Legwork Phase, roll +the contact rating of the NPC.

outcomes.13+: You get what you want and a little something extra (choose either Secrets or Gear). Add +1 to your Contact's Rating
outcomes.10+: You get what you want and a little something extra (choose either Secrets or Gear).
outcomes.7-9: You get what you want, but choose 2 from the list below:
outcomes.6-: You get what you want, but choose 2 from the list below, and the MC will choose 1 more

hold: Your request is going to cost you extra. Mark 1 Loot
Your request is going to attract unwanted attention, complications, consequences, or take extra time
Your contact needs you to help them out with something. If you turn them down, take -1 to their contact rating until you make it right
They give you what you think you should want
